teal.sim.collision

Class CollisionController

  • java.lang.Object
    • teal.sim.collision.CollisionController
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CylindricalWallCollisionController, SphereCollisionController, WallCollisionController

    public abstract class CollisionController
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class for collision controllers, which define how to resolve collisions between objects.

    • Method Detail

      • setTolerance

        public final void setTolerance(double ttolerance)
        Sets the collision tolerance for this controller. Tolerance determines the precision required to trigger a collision.
        Parameters:
        ttolerance - new tolerance (should be greater than zero).

      • getTolerance

        public final double getTolerance()
        Returns the tolerance of the CollisionController.
        Returns:
        tolerance.

      • setElasticity

        public final void setElasticity(double eelasticity)
        Sets the elasticity of this controller. Elasticity determines the amount of energy lost in a collision. An elasticity of 1.0 corresponds to a perfectly elastic collision, while a value of zero corresponds to a completely inelastic collision.
        Parameters:
        eelasticity -

      • getElasticity

        public final double getElasticity()
        Returns the elasticity of this CollisionController.
        Returns:
        elasticity.

      • setObject

        public final void setObject(HasCollisionController oobject)
        Sets the object to which this CollisionController is attached.
        Parameters:
        oobject - object.

      • getObject

        public final HasCollisionController getObject()

      • collisionStatus

        public abstract int collisionStatus(CollisionController x)
        This method should return the state of collision between this CollisionController and the one passed as an argument. The returned value should be an ORed int of the possible collision states (not colliding, colliding, interpenetrating, adhering, etc). The method is abstract, as the details of calculating these states depends on the types of CollisionControllers involved.
        Parameters:
        x - the CollisionController to test against.
        Returns:
        an ORed int representing the collision state.

      • interpenetrates

        public abstract boolean interpenetrates(CollisionController x)
        This method should test whether this CollisionController interpenetrates with the one passed as an argument. Interpenetration is defined as an overlap of the colliding geometry outside the tolerance range for a successful collision. Interpenetration needs to be resolved in the collision tracking phase.
        Parameters:
        x - the CollisionController to test against.
        Returns:
        do these CollisionControllers interpenetrate?

      • collides

        public abstract boolean collides(CollisionController x)
        This method should test whether this CollisionController collides with the one passed as an argument. Collision is defined as contact between two two geometries within the specified tolerance range.
        Parameters:
        x - the CollisionController to test against.
        Returns:
        are these CollisionControllers colliding?

      • adheres

        public abstract boolean adheres(CollisionController x)
        This method should test whether this CollisionController is adhered to the one passed as an argument. Adherence is defined as resting contact between the two geometries, and is used to resolve collisions between objects that are in constant contact.
        Parameters:
        x - the CollisionController to test against.
        Returns:
        are these CollisionControllers adhered to one another?

      • touchDirection

        public abstract javax.vecmath.Vector3d touchDirection(CollisionController x)
        This should return a vector pointing from this CollisionController to the one passed as an argument.
        Parameters:
        x - the CollisionController to which you want to find the touch direction.
        Returns:
        a vector representing this direction.

      • resolveCollision

        public abstract void resolveCollision(CollisionController x)
        Provided a collision has occured, this method should resolve the collision between this CollisionController and the one passed as an argument. Resolution of a collision involves calculating reflected trajectories, impulses, etc., and depends completely on the geometry of the CollisionControllers involved.
        Parameters:
        x - the CollisionController with which to resolve the collision.

      • resolveAdherence

        public abstract void resolveAdherence(CollisionController x)
        This method should be used to resolve adherence between this CollisionController and the one passed as an argument. Adherence involves resting contact, and is thus resolved somewhat differently than a regular collision. The details of this resolution depend heavily on the geometry of the CollisionControllers involved.
        Parameters:
        x - the CollisionController with which to resolve adherence.

      • set

        public void set(CollisionController c)
        This method sets the properties of this CollisionController to match those of the one passed as an argument.
        Parameters:
        c - the CollisionController whose properties (tolerance, elasticity, associated object) should be copied.

      • set_default

        public void set_default(HasCollisionController oobject)
        Sets default values for this CollisionController.
        Parameters:
        oobject - object to associate with this CollisionController.

      • replica

        public abstract CollisionController replica()
        This method should return a copy of this CollisionController.
        Returns:
        a copy of this CollisionController.
